text:
With Tomcat 3.3-m1, basic authentication doesn't work when using
Apache/mod_jserv.  I have tried the mod_jserv.so from 3.2.1, 3.3-m1 and a
self-compiled with the same result.  Have also tried with 3/14/01 nightly Tomcat
build w/o success.

A snoop.jsp placed in a directory that Apache requires authentication on returns
the remote user as null but recognizes the other header, including that it's
Basic Authorization scheme.

Exact same configuration running with Tomcat 3.2.1 & mod_jserv works fine.
It also works fine with Tomcat 3.3-m1 & mod_jk.

If you would like an example of this, let me know and I'll get it set up on an
accessible server.
creator: jlk@windchill.com
nacho@apache.org
text:
Try to change  the requestInterceptor line on your server.xml file to:

        <RequestInterceptor 
         className="org.apache.tomcat.modules.server.Ajp12Interceptor"
         port="8007" 
         tomcatAuthentication="false"
         />

I think i left a bad default on a IIS related non documented feature...

Adding the tomcatAuthentication attribute didn't do anything for me.  Tried
against 3.3-m1 and 3/14/01 nightly build.
